title: Featured jobs this week at GLUCK+, Nwankpa Design, nARCHITECTS, KGM Architectural Lighting, and Carlos Zapata Studio
author: Nathaniel Bahadursingh
excerpt: Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City/Brooklyn and Los Angeles/El Segundo. For even more opportunities, visit...
text: Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City/Brooklyn and Los Angeles/El Segundo. For even more opportunities, visit the Archinect job board and explore our active community of job seekers, firms, and schools. New York City-based architecture, construction, and development firm GLUCK+ has openings for a Project Architect and an Entry Level Designer. The Project Architect should have three to five years of experience, proficiency with Revit, AutoCAD, and Adobe Creative Suite, and experience working on institutional/educational and multi-family residential projects. The Designer should have up to three years of experience, experience with Revit and AutoCAD, construction documentation experience on single family, mixed use, and/or institutional projects. House (s) in the Mountains by GLUCK+.In Los Angeles, Nwankpa Design is hiring for an Intermediate Architectural Designer | Aviation with three to six years of experience, ideally with commercial, aviation, or transportation sector projects. Applicants should be proficient with Revit, have a strong understanding of building systems, construction detailing, and coordination practices, be able to work work collaboratively within large, multidisciplinary teams, and possess excellent communication and organizational skills. Textile House 1 by Nwankpa Design.nARCHITECTS has two exciting job opportunities available in Brooklyn: a Project Architect / Intermediate Designer with a minimum of five to ten years of experience and proficiency with Revit, Rhino, Adobe Creative Suite, and Microsoft Office; and a Communications and Business Development Coordinator with a minimum of one to three years of related experience, skills with Adobe Creative Suite, and graphic design abilities. Both roles require strong multi-tasking and communication skills. A/D/O by nARCHITECTS.Multidisciplinary design firm Carlos Zapata Studio is looking to hire an Intermediate Architect with at least five to seven years of experience in New York City. Candidates must have experience with commercial, hospitality and mixed-use projects, as well as be proficient with AutoCAD, Rhino, and Adobe Creative Suite. Sculptura Ardmore by Carlos Zapata Studio.KGM Architectural Lighting is seeking a Senior Lighting Designer in El Segundo, California. Applicants should be prepared to lead the design, planning, and execution of projects, work directly with senior leadership, and represent KGM Lighting in both client meetings and industry events. Su Sheng Liang by KGM Architectural Lighting.If you don't already, follow Archinect on Instagram, Facebook, X, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Threads, and BlueSky, as well as on our dedicated Archinect Jobs Instagram, Facebook, X, and Threads feeds.
html:
Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City/Brooklyn and Los Angeles/El Segundo.

For even more opportunities, visit the Archinect job board and explore our active community of job seekers, firms, and schools.

New York City-based architecture, construction, and development firm GLUCK+ has openings for a Project Architect and an Entry Level Designer. The Project Architect should have three to five years of experience, proficiency with Revit, AutoCAD, and Adobe Creative Suite, and experience working on institutional/educational and multi-family residential projects. The Designer should have up to three years of experience, experience with Revit and AutoCAD, construction documentation experience on single family, mixed use, and/or institutional projects.

In Los Angeles, Nwankpa Design is hiring for an Intermediate Architectural Designer | Aviation with three to six years of experience, ideally with commercial, aviation, or transportation sector projects. Applicants should be proficient with Revit, have a strong understanding of building systems, construction detailing, and coordination practices, be able to work work collaboratively within large, multidisciplinary teams, and possess excellent communication and organizational skills.

nARCHITECTS has two exciting job opportunities available in Brooklyn: a Project Architect / Intermediate Designer with a minimum of five to ten years of experience and proficiency with Revit, Rhino, Adobe Creative Suite, and Microsoft Office; and a Communications and Business Development Coordinator with a minimum of one to three years of related experience, skills with Adobe Creative Suite, and graphic design abilities. Both roles require strong multi-tasking and communication skills.

Multidisciplinary design firm Carlos Zapata Studio is looking to hire an Intermediate Architect with at least five to seven years of experience in New York City. Candidates must have experience with commercial, hospitality and mixed-use projects, as well as be proficient with AutoCAD, Rhino, and Adobe Creative Suite.

KGM Architectural Lighting is seeking a Senior Lighting Designer in El Segundo, California. Applicants should be prepared to lead the design, planning, and execution of projects, work directly with senior leadership, and represent KGM Lighting in both client meetings and industry events.

If you don't already, follow Archinect on Instagram, Facebook, X, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Threads, and BlueSky, as well as on our dedicated Archinect Jobs Instagram, Facebook, X, and Threads feeds.
